title: Calories in Pork Ribs
meta_description: Discover calories in pork ribs per 100g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: Cooked baby back pork ribs, roasted without sauce; edible portion only (lean and fat, bone removed).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut (spare vs. baby back), cooking method, fat trimming, and added sauces; check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked pork ribs provides ~280 kcal and ~25g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g pork ribs?
faqs.a: Approximately 280 kcal for cooked baby back pork ribs.

faqs.q: What is the protein in pork ribs?
Are pork ribs high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20g total fat per 100g, including 7g saturated.
Typically 0g carbs, unless sauce or breading is added.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in pork ribs?
faqs.a: Grilling or roasting keeps calories lower; braising or frying can add 50-100 kcal per 100g from absorbed fats.
